dc_description_s: This polygon shapefile shows the areas innundated by the centinnial flood of the Seine River in Paris, France during 1740. This layer distinguishes the flooded areas by direct submersion of the Seine ('roads') and those by the upwelling in the cellars ('caves').The ALPAGE programme aims to provide collaborative tools for the Humanities and Social Sciences and for Information Communication Technology (ICT) allowing for the development of research about the Parisian urban area. This aim is achieved by means of a GIS that includes cadastral and historical layers.
dc_publisher_s: Analyse Diachronique de l'espace Urbain Parisien: Approche Geomatique
